subscribe-card-teamplan: >Schalte die volle Leistung der Zusammenarbeit! Erstelle unbegrenzt viele Prganisationen, Teams und Hierarchien. Teile Vorlagen Share templates nahtlos mit Teams und weise benutzerdefinierte Rollen. Hebe deine Arbeitsabl√§ufe auf ein neues Niveau!
subscribe-card-plan: Schalte Premium-Features frei beginnend bei {{premiumPrice}}/Monat. Erhalte erh√∂hte Performance und nur {{addonPrice}} pro zus√§tzlichem Credit nach dem enthaltenen Premium Credits.
user-name-limit-char: Um einen Benutzernamen mit weniger als 8 Zeichen zu verwenden bitte subscriben.
public-profile-help: Das ist deine √∂ffentliche URL. Kopiere oder teile sie mitd dem Unterzeichner, und du wirst in der Lage sein, alle deine √∂ffentlich gemachten Vorlagen zu sehen.
tagline-help: Dieser Untertitel wird auf deinem √∂ffentlichen OpenSign-Profil sichtbar sein, z.B. https://opensign.me/alex
password-case: Passwort sollte bestehen aus Gro√übuchstaben, Kleinbuchstaben, Ziffern

report-help.Draft Documents: Das sind Dokumente, die du begonnen, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen hast.
report-help.Need your sign: Das ist eine Liste von Dokumenten, die auf deine Unterschrift warten.
report-help.In-progress documents: Das ist eine Liste von Dokumenten, die du an andere zur Unterschrift gesendet hast.
report-help.Completed Documents: Das ist eine Liste von Dokumenten, die von allen Teilnehmen unterschrieben wurde..
report-help.Declined Documents: Das ist eine Liste von Dokumenten, die von mindestens einem Teilnehmer abgelehnt wurde
report-help.Expired Documents: Das ist eine Liste von Dokumenten, die das Ablaufdatum erreicht haben.
report-help.Contactbook: Das ist eine Liste von Kontakten / Unterschreibener, die du hinzugef√ºgt hast. Diese werden als Vorschl√§ge angezeigt, wenn du versuchst, Unterzeichner zu einem neuen Dokument hinzuzuf√ºgen.
report-help.Templates: Das ist eine Liste von Vorlagen, die dir zur Erstellung neuer Dokumente zur Verf√ºgung stehen. Du kannst mit dem Klick auf 'verwenden' ein neues Dokument auf Basis der Vorlage erstellen, ver√§ndern und im n√§chsten Schritt Unterzeichner hinzuf√ºgen.

send-in-order-help.p1: W√§hle, wie die Unterzeichnungs-Anfrage an die Unterschreiben vesendet werden:
send-in-order-help.p2: Mit dieser Option wird die Unterzeichnungsanfrage zuerst an den ersten Unterzeichner verschickt. Nach Unterzeichnung durch den ersten Unterzeichner wird der n√§chste Unterzeichner aufgefordert zu unterschreiben. Dieser Prozess l√§uft so lange, bis alle Unterzeichner das Dokument unterschrieben haben. Diese Methode stellt sicher, dass das Dokument in einer festgelegten Reihenflge unterschrieben wird.
send-in-order-help.p3: Mit dieser Option wird die Unterzeichnungsanfrage gleichzeitig an alle Unterzeichner verschickt. Jeder Unterzeichner kann nach belieben das Dokument unzerschreiben, unabh√§ngig von den anderen Unterzeichnern. Diese Methode ist schneller, stellt aber keine feste Reihenfolge der Unterschriften sicher.
send-in-order-help.p4: W√§hle die Option, die am besten auf die Bed√ºrfnisse des Ablaufs f√ºr dein Dokument zutrifft.

select-folder-help: <TODO>If you do not select a folder, your signed document will be saved in the Main OpenSign drive folder.
signers-help: <TODO>Begin typing a contact's name to see suggested signers from your saved contacts or add new ones. Arrange the signing order by adding signers in the desired sequence. Use the '+' button to include signers and the 'x' to remove them. Each signer will receive an email prompt to sign the document in the order listed.

role-help.p2: <TODO>Begin by specifying each role needed for the completion of the document. Think about the parties involved in the  signing process and what their responsibilities are. Common roles include HR for internal documents, Customer for agreements or Vendor for business agreements.
role-help.p4: <TODO>For roles that consistently involve the same individual (e.g., the CEO's signature on employee offer letters), you can pre-attach a user to a role within the template. This step is optional but recommended for efficiency and consistency across documents.
role-help.p5: <TODO>When do i specify the user attached to each role?
role-help.p6: <TODO>When you create a document from your template, you'll be prompted to attach users to each defined role. If a role already has a user attached, this will be pre-filled, but you can modify it as needed before sending out the document.

tour-mssg.home-layout-1: <TODO>You have logged in successfully! Let's take a look.
tour-mssg.home-layout-2: <TODO>To upload documents for self-signing or to request others‚Äô signatures, simply select the respective buttons.
tour-mssg.home-layout-3: <TODO>You are ready to start using OpenSign! If you need support feel free to contact us.
tour-mssg.generate-token: <TODO>Upgrade now to generate production API token.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-1: <TODO>Click on the breadcrumb links to easily navigate through the folder hierarchy and view the documents within each folder.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-2: <TODO>Click the add button to create a new folder or document.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-3: <TODO>Sort your documents by Date or Name using this menu.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-4: <TODO>Click on this menu to display the documents in list view.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-5: <TODO>The document list is displayed according to the selected sorting option. Icons next to each document indicate its current status.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-6: <TODO>Right-click on a document to see options such as Download, Rename, Move, and Delete. Click on the document to open it.
tour-mssg.opensign-drive-7: <TODO>Right-click on any folder to see options. Choose ‚ÄòRename‚Äô to change the folder‚Äôs name or click on the folder to navigate through its contents.
tour-mssg.pdf-request-file-1: <TODO>List of signers who still need to sign the document .
tour-mssg.pdf-request-file-2: <TODO>Click any of the placeholders appearing on the document to sign. You will then see options to draw your signature, type it, or upload an image .
tour-mssg.pdf-request-file-3: <TODO>Click the Back, Decline, or Finish buttons to navigate your document. Use the ellipsis menu for additional options, including the Download button .
tour-mssg.pdf-request-file-4: <TODO>List of signers who have already signed the document .
tour-mssg.pdf-request-file-5: <TODO>You can click 'Auto Sign All' to automatically sign at all the locations meant to be signed by you. Make sure that you review the document properly before you click this button .
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-1: <TODO>Select a recipient from this list to add a place-holder where he is supposed to sign.The placeholder will appear in the same colour as the recipient name once you drop it on the document.
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-2: <TODO>Clicking 'Add recipients' button will allow you to add more signers.
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-3: <TODO>Click this button to add more recipients/signers to the document.
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-4: <TODO>Drag or click on a field to add it to the document.
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-5: <TODO>The PDF content area already displays the template's existing placeholders. For your convenience, these placeholders will match the color of the recipient's name, making them easily identifiable.
tour-mssg.placeholder-sign-6: <TODO>Clicking 'Send' will save the document. In the next step you can customize the emails to be sent out to the recipients or copy the signing links and share those with the recipients yourself.
tour-mssg.report-1: <TODO>Click the 'Add' button to create a new template. Templates are reusable documents designed to quickly generate new documents with the same structure and varying signers. For example, an HR template for onboarding could have predefined roles like ‚ÄòHR Manager‚Äô and ‚ÄòNew Employee‚Äô. Each time you use the template, you can assign the ‚ÄòNew Employee‚Äô role to different incoming staff members, while the ‚ÄòHR Manager‚Äô role remains constant, facilitating a seamless onboarding process for each recruit.
tour-mssg.redirect: <TODO>Click the 'Use' button to create a new document from an existing template.
tour-mssg.bulksend: <TODO>To quickly create and send multiple documents using an existing template, click the 'Quick Send' button.
tour-mssg.option: <TODO>This menu reveals more options such as Edit & Delete. Use the 'Edit' button to add signer roles, modify fields, and update your template. Changes will apply to all future documents created from this template but won‚Äôt affect existing documents.Use the Delete button you can delete template.
tour-mssg.signyour-self-1: <TODO>Select and drag your preferred widgets onto the PDF to customize your document before signing. Choose the perfect spots for each modification to tailor the document to your needs.
tour-mssg.signyour-self-2: <TODO>Drag and drop anywhere in this area. You can resize and move it later.
tour-mssg.template-placeholder-1: <TODO>Clicking 'Add role' button will allow you to add various signer roles. You can attach users to each role in subsequent steps.
tour-mssg.template-placeholder-2: <TODO>Once roles are added, select a role from list to add a place-holder where he is supposed to sign. The placeholder will appear in the same colour as the role name once you drop it on the document.
tour-mssg.template-placeholder-3: <TODO>Drag or click on a field to add it to the document.
tour-mssg.template-placeholder-4: <TODO>Drag the placeholder for a role anywhere on the document.Remember, it will appear in the same colour as the name of the recipient for easy reference.
tour-mssg.template-placeholder-5: <TODO>Clicking 'Next' will store the current template. After saving, you‚Äôll be prompted to create a new document from this template if you wish.
tour-mssg.Need your Signature: <TODO>Clicking on this card will take you to the list of documents awaiting your review.
tour-mssg.Out for signatures: <TODO>Clicking on this card will take you to a list of documents awaiting signature.
tour-mssg.Recent signature requests: <TODO>This is a list of documents that are waiting for your signature.
tour-mssg.Recently sent for signatures: <TODO>This is a list of documents you've sent to other parties for signature.
tour-mssg.Drafts: <TODO>This are documents you have started but have not finalized for sending.
tour-mssg.public-template: <TODO>This video demonstrates how to set up your personalized public profile, such as ‚Äòhttps://opensign.me/your-username‚Äô. You‚Äôll also learn how to customize your tagline and make your templates available for public signing.

help-test-token: <TODO>This token can be used to test the APIs at the https://sandbox.opensignlabs.com/api/v1 endpoint, allowing you to conduct unlimited document signatures. Please note that the sandbox API will sign your documents with self-signed certificates, which may not be recognized as valid by Adobe. Once you‚Äôve completed your testing, you can upgrade to one of our paid plans to generate a production token.
help-api-token: <TODO>This token can be used to access the production APIs at the {{origin}}/api/v1 endpoint. It can only be generated on one of our paid plans.

istourenabled-help.p3: <TODO>Tip: If your signers are familiar with OpenSign and frequently use it, you may want to disable the guided tour for a more seamless experience. Choose the option that best fits your document signing needs.
